abstract: 'That's over, we've forgotten it, that's out. That was their attitude.'
description: Joyce Bryan was a witness to the return of the Prisoners of War from Japan. She provides an powerful and detailed rendering of the emotionally charged return and the struggles of the men to fit back into society.
